summary: Treasury's Hardest Hit Fund provided nearly $10 billion to states that experienced high unemployment and large drops in home prices during the housing crisis. States use the funds to help homeowners avoid foreclosure or to demolish blighted properties. Treasury monitors states' use of these funds by collecting reports on performance and spending and conducting site visits, which are important monitoring practices. However, because states don’t...
title: Troubled Asset Relief Program: Monitoring of the Hardest Hit Fund Program Could Be Strengthened
